body.para: The hydraulic power pack is used to supply hydraulic fluid to the fixture to operate the solenoids. The power pack can be controlled in two ways, intermittent or continuous On. Optional to the power pack, a level sensor and temperature sensor for the oil can be added.
Base on the type of hydraulic power pack selected, the control of the power pack will varies. the
following are alarms and warnings applicable to the power pack.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: The thermal relay (TH260) of the hydraulic motor has tripped. Open the MTC cabinet and reset the thermal switch. Allow the machine to cool and restart the machine.

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;

para.text: Hydraulic oil level is low. Stop the machine and refill the hydraulic fluid.

para.text: Hydraulic oil temperature is high. Switch Off the machine. Allow the oil to cool and restart the machine.

para.text: The intermittent control power pack is On for too long. Pressure is not building up in the power pack. Check for leakage in the manifold and pipes.
